title.narrative: INCLUSIVE EDUCATION - PRIMARY SCHOOL

description.narrative: By end of 2015, the education system and municipal institutions ensure that primary school is inclusive and that statutory mechanisms and services are resourced and functioning to identify risk and prevent school drop-out., which contributes to Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2015, more excluded children and families benefit from education, social welfare, and justice services, in line with new legislation.

System strengthening - community participation and social accountability, e.g. school management committees
System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities
System strengthening - risk informed programming, including climate, resilience, disaster, conflict, and emergency preparedness
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By end of 2015, the education system and municipal institutions ensure that primary school is inclusive; and that statutorymechanisms and services are resourced and functioning to identify risk and prevent school drop-out.
% of municipalities with a functioning inter-sectoral Commission for Inclusive Education
% of primary schools that have successfully applied measures for violence prevention (were certified as Schools without Violence)
Availability and application of minimum package of drop-out prevention measures within the education system (e.g. identification of risk and individual support)

actual.value: 2015:The minimum package is being piloted in 10 schools from 7 LSGs (covering 7,000 children and 700 teachers)

title.narrative: Availability and application of per-capita funding formula that takes into account the cost of inclusion

target.value: 2015:The new funding formula for allocating resources per student takes into account costs of inclusion and is applied

actual.value: 2015:No per-capita funding formula established yet. Introduction is additionally prolonged due to changes of the umbrella law (under way).
